gettingStarted.title: Getting Started ‚Ä¢ EasyLanguage
gettingStarted.description: EasyLanguage compatibility (TradeStation/MultiCharts), installation, data, logic and optimization.

deliverables.title: Compatibility and deliverables
deliverables.compat: Compatibility: The strategy is designed for EasyLanguage, usable on TradeStation and MultiCharts (PowerLanguage). Other platforms are not compatible.
deliverables.manual: PDF manual with installation, rules and risk management.
deliverables.panel: Access to the Live Panel and 24/6 support.
deliverables.note: Download links are sent to the PayPal email and enabled in the panel.

requirements.title: Minimum requirements
requirements.conn: Stable connection (‚â• 20 Mbps) and machine with 8 GB RAM or more.
requirements.platform: Compatible platform to execute: TradeStation or MultiCharts (EasyLanguage).
requirements.provider: Data provider/broker enabled for chosen instruments (ES/MES or GC/MGC).

s1.title: 1) Download and organize the package
s1.l1: Download the ZIP from the provided link.

s2.title: 2) TradeStation (.ELD)
s2.l1: File ‚Üí Import/Export EasyLanguage ‚Üí Import ‚Üí select the .ELD.
s2.l2: Open a chart of the symbol (ES/MES or GC/MGC), 1m/5m timeframe.
s2.l3: Insert the Strategy via Insert ‚Üí Strategy and select the AInside strategy.
s2.l4: Set Inputs according to /params/*.json (plan and cycle).
s2.l5: Sessions: use recommended session template (CME RTH) per instrument.

s3.title: 3) MultiCharts (.PLA) + QuoteManager
s3.l2: Open QuoteManager ‚Üí File ‚Üí Import Data ‚Üí ASCII to load /data/*.csv.
s3.l4: On chart, insert the Signal/Study and set Inputs like /params.
s3.l5: Sessions: select proper CME session template for the symbol.

s4.title: 4) Parameters, backtest and optimization
s4.l2: Backtest ‚â• 2 years; metrics: Profit Factor, Max Drawdown, Win%, Sharpe.
s4.l3: Optimize within sensible ranges; use out-of-sample to avoid overfitting.
s4.l4: Risk: position sizing, stop (ATR/fixed), daily loss limits.

s5.title: 5) Trading and best practices
s5.l1: Sync system clock; minimize feed latency.
s5.l2: Start in demo for 2‚Äì4 weeks before going live.
s5.l3: Keep a disciplined journal and update when new versions release.

logic.title: Strategy logic (summary)
logic.l1: Regimes: context detection (trend/range) via lookbacks and filters.
logic.l2: Volatility: thresholds via ATR/averages to enable/disable signals.
logic.l3: Entries: continuation/pullback patterns by regime and instrument.
logic.l4: Management: dynamic stops/targets, trailing, daily limits.
logic.note: Input names and suggested ranges are included in /params.

gallery.title: Screenshot gallery (EasyLanguage)
gallery.empty: Place your images in /public/guide named ts-1.png, ts-2.png, ts-3.png to display them here.

slides.ts2: Short signal with ATRStopS and intrabar update

tsViz.title: Visualization in TradeStation
tsViz.desc: In TradeStation, the strategy shows entry/exit arrows, trade lines, ATRStopL/S labels, Long/Short markers, and events like EndOfDay. If you don't see them:
tsViz.l1: Right-click chart ‚Üí Format Strategies ‚Üí Properties tab:
tsViz.l2: Enable 'Show strategy orders on chart' and 'Show entries/exits'.
tsViz.l3: In Settings: turn on 'Use Look-Inside-Bar Back-testing (LIBB)' at 1 tick for realistic stops.
tsViz.l4: Verify Session template (CME RTH) and correct symbol/contract (e.g., MGCZ25, SILZ25).
tsViz.l5: Recommended timeframe: 1‚Äì5 minutes; standard bars, not Heikin Ashi.
tsViz.tip: Tip: open Strategy Performance Report to validate metrics and equity curve.

validation.title: Quick validation checklist
validation.l1: Correct symbol and expiration (ES/MES or GC/MGC; e.g., MGCZ25).
validation.l2: Proper session template (CME RTH) and expected time zone.
validation.l3: Strategy inserted and Inputs loaded from /params.
validation.l4: LIBB/IOG configured for realistic backtest; arrows/trades visible.
validation.l5: Data without gaps: range ‚â• 2 years for backtest/optimization.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions (EasyLanguage)
faq.q1: I don't see entries/exits on the chart
faq.a1: Check Format Strategies ‚Üí Properties: enable showing orders/entries and apply the correct session. Ensure you are not using synthetic bars (Heikin Ashi).
faq.a2: Enable Look-Inside-Bar Back-testing (1 tick) and use high-resolution data. Adjust slippage/commissions in Properties.
faq.q3: CSV data won't import in MultiCharts
faq.a3: Import via QuoteManager ‚Üí File ‚Üí Import Data ‚Üí ASCII with columns timestamp,open,high,low,close,volume (UTC) and comma separator.
faq.a4: Dynamic ATR-based stop levels for Long/Short positions. They update intrabar if LIBB/IOG is enabled.

tradingPage.title: What is Trading?
tradingPage.subtitle: Discover how to make informed decisions in financial markets and why AIinside.me technology makes the difference

whatIs.title: Understanding Trading
whatIs.p1: Trading is the buying and selling of financial assets (stocks, currencies, cryptocurrencies, futures) with the goal of making profits by taking advantage of market fluctuations. Unlike long-term investing, trading seeks benefits in shorter timeframes.
whatIs.p2: Success in trading doesn't depend on luck, but on well-defined strategies, rigorous technical analysis, disciplined risk management, and emotional control. Professional traders spend years perfecting their systems and learning to interpret market patterns.
whatIs.dayTrading: Operations that open and close the same day
whatIs.swingTrading: Hold positions for days or weeks
whatIs.scalping: Multiple quick operations with small gains

goodStrategies.title: How to Identify Good Strategies?
goodStrategies.description: Not all strategies are equal. Learn to evaluate their effectiveness

backtesting.title: Rigorous Backtesting
backtesting.desc: A good strategy must be tested with real historical data for at least 3-5 years. If it worked in the past under different market conditions, it's more likely to work in the future.

winRate.title: Win Rate + Risk/Reward
winRate.desc: You don't need to win 90% of the time. A strategy with 40% accuracy but a 1:3 risk/reward ratio is profitable. What matters is that gains exceed losses in the long run.

drawdown.title: Controlled Drawdown
drawdown.desc: The best strategies limit maximum losses. A drawdown above 30% can be psychologically devastating and financially dangerous.

consistency.title: Time Consistency
consistency.desc: The strategy should show consistent profitability month to month, year after year. A 3-month winning streak guarantees nothing. Look for patterns of 2-3 years minimum.

warning.title: Warning:
warning.desc: Beware of strategies promising 100% accuracy or guaranteed profits. Trading always involves risk. What makes the difference is how you manage that risk.

dangers.title: What You Must Watch Out For
dangers.description: Trading has real risks you need to know

overtrading.title: Overtrading
overtrading.desc: Opening too many trades due to anxiety or boredom. Each trade has costs (commissions, spreads) that accumulate quickly.

revenge.title: Revenge Trading
revenge.desc: Trying to recover losses immediately with impulsive trades. It's the fastest way to lose your capital.

leverage.title: Excessive Leverage
leverage.desc: Using 100x leverage can multiply gains, but it can also liquidate your account in minutes. Start with low leverage (2x-5x).

fomo.title: FOMO and Panic
fomo.desc: Entering trades because "everyone is winning" or selling because "everyone is selling" destroys discipline.

noStopLoss.title: Not Using Stop Loss
noStopLoss.desc: A well-placed stop loss protects you from catastrophic losses. Never trade without one.

scams.title: Signals and Telegram Groups
scams.desc: 95% of "gurus" selling signals lose money. If they really made millions, they wouldn't need to sell you anything.

whoUses.title: Who Uses Algorithmic Trading Tools?
whoUses.p1: Automated trading tools are not just for financial institutions. Today, individual traders, professional teams, and investment funds use algorithmic systems to:
whoUses.point2: Operate 24/7 without being in front of the screen
whoUses.point3: Execute complex strategies with pinpoint accuracy
whoUses.point4: Quick backtesting of ideas on years of historical data
whoUses.p2: From beginner traders who want to learn without risking real capital, to professionals managing millions, everyone benefits from well-designed systems.

solution.title: Why AIinside.me is the Solution
solution.subtitle: Cutting-edge technology at your fingertips
solution.p1: AIinside.me is not another trading course or signal group. It's an AI-powered algorithmic trading platform that allows you to test, optimize, and execute strategies professionally.

ai.title: Real Artificial Intelligence
ai.desc: Our algorithms analyze patterns in real-time, optimize parameters automatically, and adapt to changing market conditions.

time.title: Massive Time Savings
time.desc: Spending 8 hours daily analyzing charts? With AIinside.me, the system works for you. Get your life back while AI operates 24/7.

mentalPeace.title: Total Mental Peace
mentalPeace.desc: No more anxiety waiting for the market to move. No more insomnia over open positions. The system manages risk with clear, objective rules.

backtesting.title: Instant Backtesting
backtesting.desc: Test any strategy on years of historical data in seconds. No more Excel or manual calculations. See real results before risking a penny.

solution.timeSavedDesc: That's 2,400+ hours per year you can dedicate to what really matters

cta.title: Ready to Transform Your Trading?
cta.description: Try our strategies in demo, risk-free. Discover how AI can change the way you trade.

algoTradingPage.title: Algorithmic Trading
algoTradingPage.subtitle: Professional EasyLanguage Strategies for TradeStation and MultiCharts

whatIs.title: What is Algorithmic Trading?
whatIs.p1: Algorithmic trading represents the vanguard of modern financial markets: quantitative systems that execute investment strategies through advanced mathematical models, rigorous statistical analysis, and high-frequency automated execution.
whatIs.p2: Algorithms allow eliminating emotional biases in trading, systematically analyzing market data, and executing strategies based on predefined rules.

precision.title: Pinpoint Precision
precision.desc: Exact strategy execution without emotional deviation. Rigorous backtesting on decades of historical data with statistical cross-validation.

intelligence.title: Proprietary Artificial Intelligence
intelligence.desc: Advanced Machine Learning that identifies hidden patterns, dynamically optimizes parameters, and adapts to changing market regimes in real-time.

speed.title: Efficient Execution
speed.desc: Strategies execute trades automatically based on predefined rules. No emotional delays. Consistent entry and exit points.

riskControl.title: Risk Control
riskControl.desc: Strategies with predefined stops and targets. Maximum loss per trade is determined before execution. Consistent position sizing.

diversification.title: Multi-Strategy Diversification
diversification.desc: Portfolio of uncorrelated algorithms: momentum, mean reversion, statistical arbitrage, market making. Systematic drawdown reduction.

transparency.title: Total Transparency
transparency.desc: Detailed institutional metrics: Sharpe ratio, Sortino, Calmar, Maximum Drawdown, volatility-adjusted win rate. Complete audit of every trade.

solution.title: Why AIinside.me
solution.description: Automated strategies developed with systematic methodology and extensive backtesting on historical data.

academic.title: Academic Rigor
academic.description: Our algorithms are grounded in peer-reviewed quantitative research, modern portfolio theory (Markowitz), stochastic volatility models (GARCH), and academically validated machine learning frameworks.

finalCta.title: Professional Automated Trading
finalCta.description: Algorithmic strategies with verified backtesting. Accessible monthly plans.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about our strategies and services

seo.title: Frequently Asked Questions - AIinside.me
seo.description: Find answers to your questions about algorithmic trading, strategies, refunds and technical support.

general.a1: All strategies run directly in your broker account via EasyLanguage on TradeStation or MultiCharts. We never have access to your funds, account, or trading activity. The code executes locally on your platform, ensuring complete privacy and control.
general.q2: Refund Policy: Is refund possible after download?
general.a2: IMPORTANT: As a downloadable digital product, NO REFUNDS are possible once you've downloaded the files. We recommend carefully reviewing the demo and documentation before purchasing. Download implies final acceptance of the product.
general.q3: What are the differences between the Micro, Mini plans?
general.a3: Micro offers access to 1 proven strategy ideal for small accounts ($100-$1,000). Mini includes 2 optimized strategies with priority support, perfect for serious traders ($1,000-$5,000).
general.q4: Where can I cancel my subscription?
general.a4: You can cancel your subscription anytime from your user panel in 'My Account' ‚Üí 'Subscriptions' section. You can also contact support and we'll cancel your subscription immediately.

refunds.a1: For Micro plan we recommend $100-$1,000. For Mini plan we recommend $1,000-$5,000. However, you can start with less in demo account to familiarize yourself with the strategy risk-free.
refunds.a2: We don't guarantee specific profits as it depends on market conditions, initial capital and risk management. Our strategies have shown historical results between 8-25% annually, but past performance doesn't guarantee future results.
refunds.q3: Can I change my strategy mid-month if it doesn't work for me?
refunds.a3: Yes, if you have Mini plan or higher, you can switch between available strategies anytime. For Micro plan, the change can be made when renewing your monthly subscription.

strategies.q1: How long average do I need?
strategies.a1: We recommend evaluating any strategy for at least 30-90 days to get meaningful results. Algorithmic trading requires patience - profits are medium to long-term, not overnight.
strategies.q2: What is the advantage of algorithmic trading?
strategies.a2: Eliminates emotions, operates 24/7 without supervision, executes trades with pinpoint precision, instant backtesting on years of historical data, and systematic risk management based on objective rules.
strategies.q3: Can I use the strategy on multiple accounts?
strategies.a3: The license includes use on ONE trading account. If you need to use on multiple accounts (personal/business), contact support@ainside.me for additional licenses. Each additional license has a separate cost.
strategies.q4: What platforms are compatible with the strategies?
strategies.a4: Strategies are in EasyLanguage format, compatible ONLY with TradeStation and MultiCharts (PowerLanguage). They do NOT work on TradingView, MetaTrader, NinjaTrader, or other platforms. You must have TradeStation or MultiCharts installed to use them.

technical.q1: How do I install the software?
technical.a1: After purchase, you'll receive strategy files in EasyLanguage format (.ELD for TradeStation, .PLA for MultiCharts), PDF installation manual with step-by-step instructions, recommended parameters in JSON, and access to technical support. Import the files into your platform and test in demo account first.
technical.q2: What are the benefits of algorithmic trading?
technical.a2: Emotional consistency (no FOMO, panic or revenge trading), 24/7 availability, instant execution of complex operations, scientific backtesting, multi-strategy diversification, and massive time savings (2,400+ hours per year).
technical.q3: Are you looking for additional assistance to support your decision?
technical.a3: Yes, we offer free 30-minute consultation for new clients. Contact us by email (support@ainside.me) or Telegram and a specialist will guide you to choose the ideal strategy according to your risk profile and capital.
technical.a4: No. Strategies come ready to use with step-by-step installation. You just need to follow the manual. However, if you want to customize advanced parameters, we offer technical support included in all plans.

investment.q1: Can I use the strategies on mobile devices?
investment.a1: EasyLanguage strategies require TradeStation or MultiCharts desktop software. You can access these platforms remotely via VPS (Virtual Private Server) from mobile devices, but the strategies themselves don't run natively on smartphones or tablets.
investment.a2: All our plans include detailed backtesting reports (2-3 years of historical data) and access to verified live trading results. Mini+ clients get access to real-time dashboard with transparent metrics.
investment.q3: Can I try for free before buying?
investment.a3: We offer free live demo where you can see the strategy operating in real-time with market data. Review the demo and documentation carefully before purchasing, as digital products cannot be refunded after download.

cta.title: Still have questions?
cta.description: Our team is here to help you. Contact us via email and we'll respond as soon as possible.

seo.title: Complete Algorithmic Trading Guide: Everything You Need to Know
seo.description: Discover how algorithmic trading works, its advantages, most profitable strategies and how to get started. Complete guide with real examples and institutional metrics.
seo.keywords: algorithmic trading, algo trading, trading algorithms, automated strategies, quantitative trading, trading bots, machine learning trading, high frequency trading, backtesting, python trading

hero.title: Algorithmic Trading: The Definitive Guide
hero.description: Everything you need to know about trading algorithms, from basic concepts to advanced institutional strategies. Learn how professionals make millions with automated systems.

whatIs.title: What is Algorithmic Trading?
whatIs.intro1: Algorithmic trading (or algo trading) is the use of computer programs to execute financial operations automatically, based on predefined mathematical rules. Instead of a human deciding when to buy or sell, an algorithm analyzes the market 24/7 and executes trades in milliseconds.
whatIs.intro2: Trading algorithms use quantitative analysis, processing millions of historical data points to identify profitable patterns. Automated systems are widely used in modern financial markets to analyze data and execute operations.

keyFact.title: Key Fact
keyFact.text: Currently, a large portion of trading volume in global markets is executed by automated systems. Automation is fundamental in modern trading.

comparison.title: Difference between Manual vs Algorithmic Trading

howWorks.title: How Algo Trading Works
howWorks.intro: An algorithmic trading system works in 4 main phases:

phases.title: Data Collection
phases.description: The algorithm ingests real-time data: prices, volumes, order book, news, social media sentiment, macroeconomic indicators.

phases.title: Quantitative Analysis
phases.description: Applies mathematical models (Machine Learning, statistics, technical analysis) to identify trading opportunities with high probability of success.

phases.title: Signal Generation
phases.description: When it detects an opportunity that meets predefined criteria, it generates a buy/sell signal with calculated position size.

phases.title: Automatic Execution
phases.description: Executes the order in microseconds through broker APIs, with integrated risk management (stop-loss, take-profit, trailing stops).

howWorks.exampleCode:
# Strategy: Mean Reversion on S&P 500 (ES)
IF current_price < 20_day_moving_average - (2 * standard_deviation):
    BUY 1 contract
    STOP_LOSS = entry_price - $50
    TAKE_PROFIT = 20_day_moving_average
    
ELIF current_price > 20_day_moving_average + (2 * standard_deviation):
    SELL 1 contract
    STOP_LOSS = entry_price + $50
    TAKE_PROFIT = 20_day_moving_average
howWorks.exampleNote: This basic algorithm seeks mean reversion when price deviates more than 2 standard deviations.

advantages.title: Advantages of Algorithmic Trading
advantages.intro: Algorithmic trading has revolutionized financial markets for fundamental reasons:

items.title: Extreme Speed
items.description: Algorithms execute trades in microseconds. In high-frequency markets (HFT), the difference between winning and losing can be 1 microsecond. This speed allows capturing arbitrage opportunities that disappear in milliseconds.

items.title: Zero Emotions
items.description: The manual trader's greatest enemy is fear and greed. Algorithms completely eliminate emotions, following rules without deviation. No FOMO (fear of missing out), no revenge trading, only disciplined execution.

items.title: Rigorous Backtesting
items.description: Before risking real capital, you can test your strategy on 10+ years of historical data. This shows exactly how your algorithm would have performed in different market conditions: bullish, bearish, sideways, crisis.

items.title: Automatic Risk Management
items.description: Algorithms include stop-loss, dynamic position sizing, portfolio correlation and circuit breakers. If the market moves against you, the system closes positions automatically without panic or doubts.

items.title: Multi-Strategy Diversification
items.description: You can execute multiple uncorrelated strategies simultaneously: momentum on stocks, mean reversion on forex, statistical arbitrage on crypto. This reduces systemic portfolio drawdown.

items.title: 24/7 Operation
items.description: While you sleep, your algorithm keeps monitoring global markets. Captures opportunities in Asian, European and American markets without needing to be awake 24 hours.

strategies.title: Most Profitable Algorithmic Trading Strategies
strategies.intro: There are hundreds of algorithmic strategies, but these are the most used by professional traders in 2025:

list.title: Momentum Trading
list.description: Identifies assets with strong trend and follows momentum until it exhausts. The premise: "what goes up, tends to keep going up".
details: Indicators: RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands, Rate of Change
Typical Win Rate: 45-55% but with favorable R:R (1:2 or higher)

list.title: Mean Reversion
list.description: When an asset moves too far from its historical average, it tends to return. You buy when it's "cheap" and sell when it's "expensive" relatively.
details: Indicators: Standard deviation, Z-Score, Bollinger Bands
Best in: Ranging markets, not in strong trends
Typical Win Rate: 60-70% but with tighter R:R

list.title: Statistical Arbitrage (Stat Arb)
list.description: Exploits temporary inefficiencies between correlated assets. For example, if Apple and Microsoft usually move together but Apple rises 5% and Microsoft only 1%, the algorithm bets Microsoft will catch up to Apple.
details: Requires: Cointegration analysis, pairs trading, spread analysis
Risk: Low (market-neutral, doesn't depend on market direction)

list.title: Machine Learning / AI Trading
list.description: Uses neural networks, random forests, or gradient boosting to predict price movements based on complex patterns humans cannot see.
details: Advantage: Automatically adapts strategies to new market regimes
Disadvantage: Overfitting risk (learning noise instead of signal)

technology.title: Technology and Tools Needed
technology.intro: To execute professional algorithmic trading, you need the right technology stack:
technology.investment: Initial investment: You can start with $0 using platforms like QuantConnect or Alpaca paper trading. For real trading with professional infrastructure: $500-$2,000/month on servers + data feeds.

alternative.title: Alternative: All-in-One Platforms
alternative.text: If you don't want to manage all the infrastructure, platforms like AIinside.me offer pre-built algorithms with included infrastructure. $0 setup costs, you only pay for the service.

risks.title: Risks and Important Considerations
risks.intro: Algorithmic trading is NOT a money printer. It has serious risks you must understand:

warning.title: Legal Warning
warning.text: Algorithmic trading carries risk of capital loss. Past results do not guarantee future results. Never invest money you cannot afford to lose.

list.title: Overfitting
list.description: Your algorithm may work perfectly in backtests but fail in real trading because it "learned" past patterns that don't repeat. Solution: out-of-sample validation and walk-forward testing.

list.title: Slippage and Transaction Costs
list.description: In backtests you assume you execute at exact price. In reality there is slippage (difference between expected and executed price) and commissions. High-frequency strategies are especially sensitive to this.

list.title: Technical Failures (Bugs)
list.description: A bug in your code can cost thousands of dollars in minutes. Knight Capital lost $440 million in 45 minutes due to a software error in 2012. Exhaustive testing and circuit breakers are critical.

list.title: Market Regime Changes
list.description: A strategy that works in bull market can fail in bear market. Algorithms need constant adaptation or strategy diversification for different regimes.

list.title: Institutional Competition
list.description: You compete against funds with million-dollar budgets, PhDs in mathematics and co-located servers. Obvious arbitrage opportunities disappear quickly.

getStarted.title: How to Get Started in Algorithmic Trading (Step by Step)
getStarted.intro: If you want to start in algo trading, follow this proven path:

steps.title: Learn the Fundamentals
steps.description: Before writing code, understand technical analysis, risk management and trading psychology. Start with books on technical analysis and risk management.

steps.title: Learn Python
steps.description: Python is the standard language for algo trading. Focus on pandas, numpy and matplotlib. Recommended course: 'Python for Finance' on Udemy or Coursera.

steps.title: Practice Backtesting
steps.description: Use platforms like QuantConnect, Backtrader or Zipline to test simple strategies. Start with something basic like moving average crossover.

steps.title: Paper Trading
steps.description: Execute your algorithm in real-time but with simulated money. Brokers like Alpaca and Interactive Brokers offer free paper trading.

steps.title: Real Trading (Small)
steps.description: Start with minimum capital ($500-$1,000). Don't risk more than 1-2% per trade. Monitor results daily and adjust.

cta.title: Want to Jump Straight to Professional Algorithms?
cta.description: If you don't have time to learn programming or manage infrastructure, try our ready-to-use algorithmic trading platform. Institutional algorithms without code.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
paragraphs: Algorithmic trading has democratized access to strategies that were previously only available to multi-million dollar hedge funds. With the right tools, education and discipline, individual traders can compete in global markets.

However, it's not a magic shortcut. It requires time, constant learning, strict risk management and continuous adaptation. The best algorithmic traders combine deep technical knowledge with fundamental understanding of markets.
If you're ready to take the leap, start with solid education, practice exhaustively in backtesting and paper trading, and when you move to real trading, do it with capital you can afford to lose.
The future of trading is algorithmic. The question is not whether you should learn it, but when you will start.

answers.a1: AInside is a company specialized in automated trading algorithm development. We offer strategies for S&P 500 and Gold with monthly/annual subscription.
answers.a2:
Micro S&P 500 or Micro Gold: $99/month or $990/year (20% discount).
Mini S&P 500 or Mini Gold: $999/month or $9,990/year (20% discount).

answers.a5: After subscription, you'll receive EasyLanguage code + HWID license + documentation. Simply import the file into your platform following the included guide.
answers.a6: NO. Trading involves substantial risk. We do NOT guarantee profits or results. Past results do NOT predict future ones. Each trader is responsible for their decisions.
answers.a7: Yes, you can cancel anytime from your PayPal account. No refunds for active period, but you can use the service until your paid period ends.
answers.a8: We offer technical support via email (support@ainside.me) with 24-48h response. We help with installation, configuration and technical issues with our strategies.

responses.vwap: VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price) is an indicator showing volume-weighted average price. In our strategies, we use it as market fair value reference.
responses.real: Yes, this is live streaming of a real account trading with our strategies. We show real trades to demonstrate how algorithms work in real market conditions.
responses.pnl: P&L (Profit & Loss) shows accumulated profits and losses. Remember these are real-time and past results, they do NOT guarantee future results. Trading involves risk.
responses.stream: This stream shows live operations using our strategies. It's for educational demonstration only. NOT financial advice or results guarantee.
